column4: anyone know how I can fix apt-get in 12.04 ? my router crashed when installing java, and now i cant install or recover apt-get. http://bpaste.net/show/6JksJM2aZVpv6dgyN9zT/
tried "apt-get install -f"?
yea tried that. did some stiff but didnt work.
what errors are you getting?
i pasted them in my link. but closing and reopening the terminal after those were run, seems to have fixed it.
good! :)
try to uninstall the package that's causing the issue (using -f)
you have a stale aptitude process
look for any aptitude processes using ps
then kill that sucker :)
some proc is using that config.dat. lsof|grep <whatever> file and see if that process is something that should be running
kill -9 <pid>
`lsof | grep config.dat` doesnt come up with any results
kill -9 pid killed aptitude, but still same error.
tried to uninstall the package you were trying to install?
sudo apt-get remove --purge man-db
it's getting stuck at that point
running `sudo apt-get remove --purge man-db` will uninstall my ubuntu-desktop and a lot of other things. : gnome-user-guide* man-db* ubuntu-desktop* ubuntu-docs* ubuntu-standard* yelp*
wow, use dpkg instead
dpkg -r
tried the -f flag?
aptitude install -f  ? yea i have
i'd do a dpkg -rf man-db, but i'd make sure it doesn't take the other dependent packages with it
